meanings.sent1: I like all fruits except bananas.
meanings.sent2: Everyone is going to the party except for Sarah.
meanings.sent3: The picnic was perfect except for the sudden rain.
meanings.sent4: His smile lit up the room, except for his eyes which held a hint of sadness.
meanings.sent5: The forest was peaceful, except for the occasional rustling of leaves.

meanings.sent1: She cleaned the entire house except the attic.
meanings.sent2: All the students passed the test except John.
meanings.sent3: The cake was delicious except for the burnt edges.
meanings.sent4: The garden was beautiful, except for the wilting flowers.
meanings.sent5: The room was silent, except for the ticking of the clock.

meanings.definition: To object or take exception to
meanings.sent1: He always excepts when it comes to sharing his toys.
meanings.sent2: She never excepts any criticism of her work.
meanings.sent3: The cat excepted loudly when the vet tried to give it a shot.
meanings.sent4: The child excepted vehemently to going to bed early.
meanings.sent5: The dog excepted by barking at the mailman every morning.
